thinking.disposable_income: Museum Park residents have relatively high disposable income with a median household income above Houston average, as it is an affluent area near major cultural institutions and medical centers.
thinking.discretionary_consumption: Residents have significant discretionary spending capacity and tend to value quality of life amenities, with many households able to absorb moderate increases in transportation costs.
thinking.accessibility: The neighborhood has excellent transit access with multiple bus routes and METRORail Red Line, while also having good road connectivity to downtown, medical center, and cultural institutions.
thinking.decision_rationale: 1) Given the affluent nature of the area, policies with higher taxes/fees are acceptable if they improve service 2) Strong existing transit infrastructure means transit improvements will be particularly beneficial 3) Many residents use both cars and transit, so balanced improvements to both modes are valuable 4) The area's proximity to major destinations means travel time improvements have significant impact 5) Selected policies that provide the best transit time improvements while maintaining reasonable driving options 6) Ranked proposals that balance service improvements with moderate rather than maximum cost increases
